article.title: David_Angell

template.arg: {{nowrap|[[Barrington, Rhode Island|West Barrington, Rhode Island]], U.S.}}
[[September 11 attacks|Terrorist engineered crash]] of [[American Airlines Flight 11]]

article.paragraph: David Lawrence Angell(April 10, 1946spaced ndashSeptember 11, 2001) was an Americantelevision producerproducerofsitcoms. Angell won multipleEmmy Awardsas the creator and executive producer, along withPeter Casey (screenwriter)Peter CaseyandDavid Lee (screenwriter)David Lee, of the comedy seriesFrasier. Angell and his wife Lynn both died aboardAmerican Airlines Flight 11, the first plane to hit theWorld Trade Center (1973-2001)World Trade Center, during theSeptember 11 attacks.cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/pictures/image/0,8543,-10404256105,00.htmlUS terrorism victims[[The Guardian]]September 12, 2013
article.heading: Early life and education
article.paragraph: refimprove sectionSeptember 2013Angell was born inBarrington, Rhode IslandWest Barrington, Rhode Islandto Henry and Mae (ne Cooney) Angell. He received a bachelor's degree in English Literature fromProvidence College. He entered theUnited States ArmyU.S. Armyupon graduation and served atthe Pentagonuntil 1972. He then moved toBostonand worked as a methods analyst at an engineering company and later at an insurance firm inRhode Island.Profile, legacy.com; accessed March 30, 2015.His brother, theKenneth Anthony AngellMost Rev. Kenneth Angell, is aRoman Catholic ChurchRoman Catholicprelate and formerDiocese of BurlingtonBishop of Burlington, Vermont.
article.heading: Career
article.paragraph: Angell moved toLos Angelesin 1977. His first script was sold to the producers of theAnnie Flynnseries. Five years later, he sold his second script toArchie Bunker's Place. In 1983, he joinedCheersas a staff writer. In 1985, Angell joined forces with Peter Casey and David Lee asCheerssupervising producers/writers. The trio received 37 Emmy Award nominations and won 24Emmy Awards, including the above-mentioned forFrasier, as well as an Outstanding Comedy Series Emmy forCheers, in 1989, which Angell, Casey, Lee and the series' other producers shared, and Outstanding Writing/Comedy Emmy forCheers, which Angell received in 1984. After working together as producers onCheers, Angell, Casey and Lee formedGrub Street Productions. In 1990, they created and executive-produced the comedy seriesWings (NBC TV series)Wings.
article.heading: Death
article.paragraph: Angell and his wife, Lynn, were among the passengers ofAmerican Airlines Flight 11who were killed in theSeptember 11 attacks, when the plane was hijacked by Muslim extremists and members of Al Qaeda and flown into the North Tower of theWorld Trade Center (1973-2001)World Trade CenterinNew York Cityin 2001.Bowen, Kit (September 14, 2001)."News commentator, "Frasier" producer among hijacking victims".Hollywood.com.cite newsAngell, Olson among industry victims[[The Hollywood Reporter]]September 12, 2001
article.heading: Legacy

link.part: The names of David Angell and his wife are located atop Panel N-1 of theNational September 11 Memorial's North Pool, along with other passengers from Flight 11.

article.paragraph: TheAmerican Screenwriters Associationawards the annualDavid Angell Humanitarian Awardto any individual in the entertainment industry who contributes to global well-being through donations of time, expertise or other support to improve the human condition.Citation neededFebruary 2013
Season 9, Episode 2, ofFrasier (Don Juan in Hell: Part 2), airing on September 25, 2001, ended with the memorial tribute, "In loving memory of our friends Lynn and David Angell".

At theNational 9/11 Memorial, Angell and his wife are memorialized at the North Pool, on Panel N-1, along with other passengers from Flight 11.David Lawrence Angell. Memorial Guide:National 9/11 Memorial. Retrieved December 11, 2011.-
